perturbation.original_text:
This Outsource Technology Development Agreement (this “Agreement”) is entered into and effective as of this 1st day of March, 2018
(the “Effective Date”) by and between Document Security Systems, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of New
York (“DSS”), and HotApp International Ltd., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Hong Kong (“Developer”).
perturbation.changed_text:
This Outsource Technology Development Agreement (this “Agreement”) is entered into and effective as of this 1st day of March, 2018
(the “Effective Date”) by and between Document Security Systems, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of New
York (“DSS”), and HotApp International Ltd., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Hong Kong (“Service Provider”).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Developer' to 'Service Provider' in the introductory paragraph without changing it consistently throughout the contract creates ambiguity. It is unclear whether 'Developer' and 'Service Provider' refer to the same entity, potentially impacting obligations assigned to 'Developer' later in the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
1.2.
Development Fees. As payment for Developer’s satisfactory performance of the services set forth in Schedule 1 hereto
(the “Technology Development Services”), DSS shall pay Developer the sum of US $23,000 per month, for the duration of the Term hereof, with
payments to commence on March 1, 2018.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.2.
Project Fees. As payment for Service Provider’s satisfactory performance of the services set forth in Schedule 1 hereto
(the “Technology Development Services”), DSS shall remit payment of US $20,000 on a bi-monthly basis to Service Provider, for the duration of the Term hereof, with
payments to commence on March 15, 2018.
perturbation.explanation: Changing “Development Fees” to “Project Fees,” altering the payment amount, frequency, and start date, while inconsistently using “Developer” and “Service Provider” creates significant financial uncertainty. It's unclear what the actual payment terms are, and who is entitled to what.

perturbation.original_text:
Developer hereby acknowledges DSS’s claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Improvements, and all associated
goodwill. Nothing in this Agreement or in the performance thereof, or that might otherwise be implied by law, shall operate to grant Developer any
right, title, or interest in or to the Technology or the Improvements. Developer hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may
acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Improvements, along with the goodwill associated therewith. DSS shall have the sole
right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Improvements.
Developer may not contest the validity of, by act or omission jeopardize, or take any action inconsistent with, DSS’s ownership rights or goodwill
in the Technology or Improvements, including any attempted registration of the Technology or Improvements in Hong Kong or in any other legal
jurisdiction, or any attempts to license the same to any unauthorized third Person.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Service Provider hereby acknowledges DSS’s claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Enhancements, and all associated
goodwill. Nothing in this Agreement or in the performance thereof, or that might otherwise be implied by law, shall operate to grant the primary contractor any
right, title, or interest in or to the Technology or the Enhancements. The Service Provider hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may
acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Enhancements, along with the goodwill associated therewith. DSS shall have the sole
right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Enhancements.
Subcontractor may not contest the validity of, by act or omission jeopardize, or take any action inconsistent with, DSS’s ownership rights or goodwill
in the Technology or Enhancements, including any attempted registration of the Technology or Enhancements in Hong Kong or in any other legal
jurisdiction, or any attempts to license the same to any unauthorized third Person.
perturbation.explanation: Mixing "Service Provider," "primary contractor," and "Subcontractor" while changing “Improvements” to “Enhancements” in the context of ownership rights creates severe ambiguity about who owns what and the extent of rights granted. This contradiction directly impacts intellectual property ownership and usage rights, and it's unclear who the document is referencing.
